column4: I just did a clean reinstall of Ubuntu (10.04 --> 10.10). Every time I do heavy CPU intensive work, I experience sudden shutdowns (this generally happens with overheating). But everything was working fine in 10.04 for months, so I doubt a hardware problem suddenly occured right after a reinstall. It seems that the default ACPI configuration is screwed up somehow. How should I go about fixing this?
(Thanks, by the way)
That bug report seems to be dealing with something else.
right, the bug isn't about shutting down.  Check your temperature gauges
As I said -- it seems like it is overheating. My question is why. It wasn't happening at all prior to the upgrade.
look into lm_sensors
The upgrade didn't magically fill my fans with cathair.
Something must be screwed in ACPI.
could be a driver for a sensor changed, and you've uncovered a bug.
OK. How would I diagnose this so that I can file a useful bug report. I'm not seeing anything in the logs.
like I said, look into lm_sensors logs.  I haven't looked into them in some time
... so I don't know where to guide you
Oh, sorry. I missed when you said that. I'll take a look. Thanks a bunch.
I don't have an lm_sensors log file and none of the system log files (syslog, messages, kern.log) have anything related to lm_sensors in them. Any other suggestions?
nope, sorry
(Searches for "temp" and "thermal"  also aren't turning anything up ...)(
maybe find the time of the last boot in messages or syslog, and find that
That was the first thing I did, and there is nothing.
out of luck then
Should I use sleeping pills or a plastic grocery bag?
razor blades, so much more emo
